conclusion: Determine if point O1 is to the right of point O by analyzing refraction.
Incident ray travels from point A in the air towards the boundary.
Point O1 is where the incident ray hits the boundary between air and water.
Light bends towards the normal when traveling from air to water.
Angle of incidence is between the incident ray and the normal.
Angle of refraction is between the refracted ray and the normal.
Snell's Law: n1 sin(theta_i) = n2 sin(theta_r).
Refractive index of water is greater than air, so theta_r < theta_i.
Point O is the intersection of the refracted ray with the boundary.
Refracted ray bends towards the normal, so point O is to the right of point O1.
Point O1 is to the right of point O.
